data.title: Cheryl to ‘change name from Fernandez-Versini after divorce’
data.meta_description: Ahead of her rumoured divorce from husband Jean-Bernard, Cheryl plans to drop the name Fernandez-Versini and change it back to either Cole or Tweedy, her maiden name.
data.text:
It’s all change for Cheryl!

In the wake of her romance with Liam Payne being all but confirmed, the X Factor judge is reportedly looking to the future and wants everyone to stop using the name Fernandez-Versini. Ahead of her rumoured divorce from husband Jean-Bernard, she seemingly plans to drop the name and then change it back to either Cole or Tweedy, her maiden name.

A source said to be close to Cheryl told The Sun: ‘She wants to put the marriage and an unhappy chapter in her life behind her. But there are obviously practical matters to sort out and she can’t drop it officially until the decree nisi is granted.

‘At the moment there’s still wrangling going on over the terms of the divorce.’

MORE : Jean-Bernard Fernandez Versini ‘wants to try again’ with Cheryl despite divorce proceedings

The source continued by explaining that it is more likely that Cheryl will return to using the name ‘Cole’ as Cheryl Cole ‘became a brand and wasn’t about Ashley in the end.’

Metro.co.uk have contacted a representative for Cheryl for comment.

Meanwhile, Cheryl’s rumoured romance with One Direction’s Liam has been the focus of many, with fans of the band lashing out at her for simply being linked to him. The relationship has been rumoured for a while but was seemingly confirmed when Liam changed his Instagram picture to an image of the couple cuddled up.

However, it has yet to be officially confirmed by either party that they are more than friends.

MORE : Cheryl Fernandez-Versini deals with One Direction fans abusing her over Liam Payne romance in the best possible way
